page.title: 13MOSSLEY CARNIVAL
page.content: The annual Mossley Charity Carnival was held on Saturday, 25th May 1985. The children and parents of Micklehurst Community Junior School gathered in school at 9.00 am to decorate the lorry supplied by Dolan's Containers of Stalybridge. Decorations from the school pantomime, Snow White and the Several Dwarfs, had been saved and by 12.00 the lorry was ready to set off for the Market ground in Top Mossley for the judging. After a hair-raising drive ( the driver was late ), 25 excited children found they had won first prize in the School's section and happily joined the parade on its journey through the town to the Carnival ground on Egmont Street playing fields, Micklehurst. The parade was over a mile long with bands and floats representing groups from all over Greater Manchester.
